Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse with white shelly inclusions and grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now worn, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.159)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36357) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36357)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 209 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
